__e: Do you realize that the United States is on life support right now?
E had a life-guard in the water, this I know.
Your backup in case things don't work out with you and amy.
I know you fear what will come once my Teddy has left us, but this here, what now comes to pass, shall offer us safeguards for a hundred years.
You know, like a... lifeline to my future, or something.
I swear I never used to say things like "lifeline - to my future" before I got cancer.

In Enron, it looks to me like the captain first gave himself and some friends a bonus, then lowered himself and the top folks down in the lifeboat and then hollered up and said, by the way, everything is going to be just fine.
Oh, really? I just need to know what you were trying to tell me about being a lifeguard, and then, I'll leave and you'll never see me again.
And I was your lifeline out, and you were mine, and that was okay, you know?
